content: Memory (VFM) features are offered from the main memory capacity in 0.5 TB units to increase granularity for the feature. VFM can provide much simpler management and better performance by reducing the I/O to the adapters in the PCIe+ I/O drawers. 1.3.4 I/O subsystem and I/O drawers The IBM z16 A02 and IBM z16 AGZ implement PCIe Generation 4 switch cards, which are used to connect the dual port fanout features in the CPC drawers to the I/O features in the I/O drawers. The I/O infrastructure is designed to reduce processor usage and I/O latency, and provide increased throughput and availability. For a two CPC drawer system, up to 24 PCIe+ fanout slots can be populated with fanout cards for data communications between the CPC drawers and the I/O infrastructure, and for coupling. The multiple channel subsystem (CSS) architecture allows up to three CSSs, each with 256 channels.
